Review_Text: The best behind-the-scenes documentary I've ever watched-far better than the film itself. It powerfully showcases the level of planning, logistics, talent, and determination this kind of work demands. And it touches you.It reminded me of something written by someone I once knew:"Writing falls short in conveying feelings and thoughts. No form of communication can truly express what lies in a person's mind. Each individual sees a different, boundless horizon. To perceive these horizons, one needs not education, but guidance. And the only place where true horizons can be fully grasped is in nature itself."
